mata_info.quick_summary: To change a Director Identification Number (DIN), the current DIN must be deactivated and a new DIN obtained. Begin by filing Form DIR-3 with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) for a new DIN. After obtaining the new DIN, update company records by filing Form DIR-12 to reflect the change. Ensure all forms are submitted accurately to comply with regulatory requirements and avoid penalties.

seo.title: How to Handle a Change in Director Identification Number (DIN)
seo.description: A Director Identification Number (DIN) is a unique identification number allotted to individuals who are appointed as directors of companies. If there is a need to change or update the DIN due to errors, changes in personal details, or other reasons, the process involves submitting a request to the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) through the prescribed forms. The process ensures that the DIN details remain accurate and up-to-date in the official records.

content: Director Identification Number (DIN) is a mandatory requirement for all existing and new directors of a company. A DIN is issued in accordance with the directions provided by the amendment to the Companies Act. It is an 8-digit Unique Identification Number allotted to all directors by Ministry of Corporate Affairs. It has lifetime validity.

left.question: What is a Director Identification Number (DIN)?
left.answer: A Director Identification Number (DIN) is a unique identification number assigned to individuals appointed as directors of a company. It is mandatory for all directors in India.

left.question: Why would a Director need to change their DIN?
left.answer: A DIN may need to be changed due to issues such as errors in the original DIN application, changes in personal details, or if the DIN was allocated incorrectly.

left.question: How can a Director apply to change their DIN?
left.answer: To change a DIN, the director must file an application with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) through the DIR-3 form, detailing the reasons for the change and providing the necessary documents.

left.question: What documents are required to change a DIN?
left.answer: The documents required to change a DIN include a valid identity proof, address proof, and a declaration from the director explaining the need for the change.

left.question: Is there a fee associated with changing a DIN?
left.answer: Yes, there is a nominal fee for processing the DIN change application. The exact fee can be checked on the MCA website or with the relevant authority.

right.question: How long does it take to process a DIN change application?
right.answer: The processing time for a DIN change application typically ranges from 15 to 30 days, depending on the completeness of the application and the workload of the MCA.

right.question: What happens if the DIN change application is rejected?
right.answer: If the DIN change application is rejected, the director will be notified with the reasons for rejection. They may need to address the issues and resubmit the application.

right.question: Can a DIN change be made online?
right.answer: Yes, DIN changes can be processed online through the MCA portal by submitting the DIR-3 form and other required documents electronically.

right.question: Will the change in DIN affect the director’s previous company records?
right.answer: No, changing the DIN will not affect the director’s previous company records. The new DIN will be updated across all company records, and the old DIN will be deactivated.

right.question: Can a DIN be changed if the director has multiple DINs?
right.answer: Yes, if a director has multiple DINs, they may need to consolidate them into one by following the prescribed procedure, which involves surrendering the additional DINs and ensuring only one DIN remains active.
